macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Close Mixed Friday with Weekly Declines
items.summary: The S&P 500 edged up 2.26 points to 6,915.61, Dow fell 285.30 to 49,098.71, and Nasdaq rose 65.22 to 23,501.24 amid mixed trading. Major indexes posted small weekly losses, reflecting sector rotation toward defensive positions and hesitation in early 2026.

items.title: Intel Tumbles as Wall Street Drifts; Gold Hits New Record
items.summary: Intel shares tumbled significantly, contributing to mixed market performance, while gold prices rose to another record high. Treasury yields dipped slightly, with the 10-year at 4.23%.

items.title: Clorox Acquires GOJO Industries for $2.25 Billion
items.summary: Clorox shares gained after announcing the $2.25 billion cash acquisition of Purell maker GOJO Industries. CSX climbed despite weaker-than-expected profits, buoyed by positive 2026 operating profit forecast.

items.title: Consumer Sentiment Improves; Inflation Expectations Ease
items.summary: US consumer sentiment strengthened more than expected, with inflation expectations dropping to the lowest in a year at 4%, aiding Fed's efforts to avoid inflationary cycles. S&P Global reported ongoing business activity growth.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Surge 62.6% in Three Days to Record
items.summary: Natural gas prices soared 62.6% over three days to $5.05 per million BTUs ahead of a major US winter storm, marking the largest three-day gain on record and catching speculators off guard.

items.title: Small-Cap Russell 2000 Outperforms S&P 500 for 14 Sessions
items.summary: The Russell 2000 small-cap index outperformed the S&P 500 for 14 straight trading sessions through Thursday, the longest streak since 1996, with seven record highs in 2026 amid rotation to value and cyclical stocks.

items.title: Japanese 40-Year Bond Yield Tops 4% for First Time
items.summary: Japan's 40-year government bond yield crossed 4% for the first time, surging 29.7 basis points on Tuesday to 4.0784%, the largest one-day jump since April.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Senate Agriculture Committee to Markup Crypto Market Structure Legislation on Jan. 27
items.summary: The Senate Agriculture Committee is scheduled to mark up crypto market structure legislation on January 27, following a new draft bill released by Chair John Boozman that received only Republican backing. President Trump expressed hopes to sign a crypto market structure bill soon to position America as the crypto capital of the world.

items.title: Blockchain Stocks to Watch: High Trading Volume in CORZ, FIGR, BTDR, RVYL, GLOB
items.summary: MarketBeat highlights Core Scientific (CORZ), Figure Technology Solutions (FIGR), Bitdeer Technologies Group (BTDR), Ryvyl (RVYL), and Globant (GLOB) as top blockchain stocks due to highest recent dollar trading volume, offering exposure to bitcoin mining, cloud mining, payments, and enterprise services amid volatility and regulatory risks.

items.title: Research Shows Yield-Bearing Stablecoins Could Reduce Bank Deposits and Lending
items.summary: A research paper indicates that growth in yield-bearing stablecoins will lead to contractions in bank deposits and lending, with greater stablecoin adoption causing larger reductions; this counters mischaracterizations by crypto firm Paradigm.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Apple Developing AI-Powered Wearable Pin to Challenge OpenAI and Meta
items.summary: Apple is working on a thin, flat AI wearable pin with dual cameras, potentially releasing in 2027, to compete with OpenAI's upcoming devices and Meta's smart glasses. The device features an aluminum-and-glass shell for capturing user surroundings.

items.title: Apple Plans Conversational Siri Upgrade Using Google Gemini and TPUs
items.summary: Apple is enhancing Siri with chatbot-like conversational abilities via Google's Gemini model and discussing a deal for Google's tensor processing units, shifting from on-device processing.

items.title: OpenAI Plans First Hardware Device Launch in Late 2026
items.summary: OpenAI's chief global affairs officer confirmed the company is on track to release its first hardware device in the second half of 2026, as stated at a Davos event.

items.title: OpenAI Seeking $50 Billion Funding at $830 Billion Valuation
items.summary: OpenAI is reportedly raising $50 billion at a near $830 billion valuation, with revenue reaching $20 billion, amid a volatile stock market week.

items.title: Yann LeCun Leaves Meta to Found AMI Labs Focusing on World Model AI
items.summary: Meta's Yann LeCun has departed to start AMI Labs, targeting 'world model' AI for better real-world understanding and interaction in software development applications.

items.title: Microsoft Upgrades Quantum Software Stack with AI-Assisted Programming
items.summary: Microsoft is enhancing its Quantum Development Kit (QDK) with AI tools like Copilot for quantum coding, domain libraries for chemistry and error correction, and hardware-agnostic support.

items.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp Warns AI Will Redefine Power, War, and Economies
items.summary: At the World Economic Forum 2026, Palantir's Alex Karp discussed how AI is reshaping warfare, global power dynamics, and economic structures.

items.title: Palantir: AI Reshaping Workforce Skills and Hiring Practices
items.summary: Palantir CEO Alex Karp highlights how AI is transforming organizational hiring, skill-building, and human-technology collaboration for an evolving workforce.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GTA 6 Development Budget Reportedly Exceeds $1 Billion
items.summary: Reports indicate GTA 6's budget has surpassed $1 billion, potentially setting industry records, with an expected price of $80-$100 and a confirmed release date of November 19, 2026. The game features a massive open world, improved AI, and enhanced online modes, impacting other publishers' 2026 schedules.

items.title: Handheld Gaming Devices Reach 'End-Game' Maturity with Odin 3
items.summary: An analysis suggests the handheld gaming market, exemplified by the AYN Odin 3, has matured to the point where nearly all video game history is accessible on a single device amid rising console prices and shifting industry development models.

items.title: TMMN Updates Mega Man Games Done Quick Playlists for January 2026
items.summary: New playlist updates feature recent Games Done Quick marathon content including Mega Man X, X4, Battle Network, and Mega Man-esque games like Darkwing Duck and Mighty Gunvolt from the past six months.

items.title: Speedrobo Games Releases New Video Update on January 24
items.summary: Indie developer Speedrobo Games posted a new news video covering their portfolio of games like Claim!, Card Battle Spirit Link, and services in video game development.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla Launches Limited Unsupervised Robotaxi Rides in Austin
items.summary: Tesla has initiated limited unsupervised robotaxi rides in Austin, marking a significant step in autonomous vehicle deployment. This development highlights progress in self-driving technology beyond AI-specific features.

items.title: Blue Origin Targets Enterprise Satellite Market with TeraWave
items.summary: Blue Origin announced TeraWave, aiming for 6 Tbps speeds by 2027 to capture the enterprise satellite market. This positions the company as a competitor in high-speed space communications.

items.title: Boardwalktech Launches Verity Intelligent Controls Platform
items.summary: Sophic Client Boardwalktech, Inc. (BWLK-TSXV, BWLKF-OTCQB) has launched Verity, an intelligent controls platform for enterprise use. The release underscores advancements in operational technology solutions.

items.title: IT Procurement Faces Price Increases for Servers, PCs, and Smartphones
items.summary: Procurement teams are encountering rising prices for servers, PCs, and smartphones, with advanced memory posing a larger future risk due to Nvidia's pivot. This signals ongoing supply chain pressures in hardware.
